info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:22PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pima and southern Pinal Counties through 300 PM MST... At 221 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Catalina, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Catalina, Oro Valley, Saddlebrooke, Mount Lemmon/Summerhaven and Catalina State Park. This includes Route 77 between mile markers 80 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
